data.meta_description: Nightlife THE CLUB IS WAITING Dancing around the isla clubs from Pacha to Privilege from the  Ushuaïa to Amnesia Nightlife   Music Is The Answer I Don’t Remember The Question   On the one hand, Ibiza is a real hippie island and you can relax, but at the same time Ibiza is also known worldwide … Nightlife Read More »
data.text:
Music Is The Answer I Don’t Remember The Question

On the one hand, Ibiza is a real hippie island and you can relax, but at the same time Ibiza is also known worldwide as the party mecca of Europe. We also went on an adventure a number of times in the evening and we have listed the best places to go out in Ibiza below.

Going out in Ibiza is a guarantee for a fantastic evening. The large discotheques guarantee an exciting nightlife. It is not for nothing that Ibiza is undeniably associated with clubs, music and discotheques. Ibiza is everything a person can and can expect in the party and party area. Especially during the summer, the island is a real attraction for young partygoers from all over the world who want to get in touch with what Ibiza is known worldwide for: going out, DJs and smashing parties. Since 99% of the partying takes place during the warm summer months, most clubs and discos are also only open from the beginning of June to the end of September. Exceptions to this are Pacha, open all year round, and Es Paradis and Space, which open their doors earlier in the year to welcome the nightlife crowd.

Privilege Ibiza is one of the largest clubs in the world. The club is known for the spectacular parties that are held there. What could be better than going crazy in the biggest club in Ibiza!As soon as you enter you look your eyes out. You walk down a grand staircase and are in the middle of one of the largest halls you have ever seen. The main hall of the club is just as big as a true airplane hangar.

The dance floor is also one of the largest in the world, including a real swimming pool. Above this pool you will find the DJ booth. The other clubs in Ibiza can easily fit into the main hall of this club. There is no less than enough room for 10,000 partygoers!

In addition to the largest room, you also have the Vista Club. This room is surrounded by glass and from here you have a beautiful view of Ibiza town. This is especially wonderful when the sun rises slowly while everyone is still partying.

Privilege Ibiza has been known for years because of the crazy parties like Mamumussuib. In addition, DJ Tiësto had a fixed day in the club every week for years. Today the club is best known for parties like SuperMartXe, Afterlife, I Am A Rich Bich, Creamfields, Resistance, Saura, Pure Carl Cox and Taboo Motel.

Ticket prices for the various parties in the Privilege Ibiza vary between € 35 and € 50. We recommend that you purchase the tickets through the club's official website or through special promotional teams often found around town and on popular beaches. This often saves a lot of money with the tickets at the door on the evening itself. In addition, you have a beer for € 10 and you can get mixed drinks from € 12.

You can find Privilege Ibiza near San Rafeal, near the Amnesesia Ibza. The club is easily accessible by car, but the car park is rather small in relation to the club. We therefore recommend that you leave on time if you want to go by car. In addition, every taxi driver on the island knows how to reach the club. For a taxi from San Antonia, Playa d'en Bossa or Ibiza stad you pay about € 10 to € 15.

There are also regular buses from these places to the club and the club also has its own disco bus that stops at various points on the island to pick up party people. It is about a 10-minute drive from Ibiza town. If you come from San Antonio it will take you about 15 minutes.

Also visit the official website for tickets: privilegeibiza.com

Next to sweet room is the entrance to the restaurant. You can have a nice dinner here before you start your club night in Pacha.There is something for everyone here, for example enjoy delicious sushi, pasta or a meat dish. Oh, and don't forget the heavenly cocktails!

The club also organizes several large parties such as F *** Me I'm Famous; Flower Power and Solomun +1.

David Guetta is in da house!

F*** Me I’m Famous by David Guetta is, with no doubts, the most popular event in the world. The party that every Thursday is sold out weeks in advanced, congregates more than 3.000 people as nobody wants to miss this exclusive show.

Solomun invita a DJs superestrellas a su imperio techno y house

Solomun +1

In addition to establishing itself as one of the most traditional parties in Pacha , Solomun +1 has also managed to make a place for itself among the most important events in Ibiza. Going strong on Sundays , their winning formula is very simple: the best underground electronic music combined with the legendary atmosphere of one of the island's clubbing institutions.

As you can see, all of the Solomun + 1 guest DJs are shining stars in their own right and have the same time as Solomun to shine in the booth. At the end of the night the host and his / her special guest join forces in a pompous back-to-back.The music varies according to the guest artist, of course, but lately Solomun unleashes all his power under his most melodic rhythms and the result is always sweeter than honey.

Flower Power by Pacha: a super fun evening! - Flower Power is every Wednesday evening at the Pacha, this party is unique in every way. Because Flower Power stands out among all the house and techno parties on the island.

The music comes from the Flower Power era, long before the house reached Ibiza and the decoration is also surprising!

We visited the party and take you into the 'night out'!

She comes in colors ev'rywhere

Going back to the 60s and 70s, bands like The Rolling Stones and The Beatles.In this period the foundation of current Rock music was laid.And what about the flare pants, with flared legs. John Lennon was a phenomenon and became the face of the hippie movement, the song 'Imagine' is a clear example of this.

Hippies are seen as the creators of the 'Flower power movement' which originated in the US at the time, among others. the Woodstock festival was a highlight of this. The influences can still be found on the Island.

You get everything from the party that takes place in the evening. You often see the parades on the beach passing through the city the day of the party. This cozy phenomenon automatically invites you to go to the party. The Pacha - 'Flower Power' shop In Ibiza Town where you can take a picture with the statue or simply score a nice souvenir of the Flower Power evening.

On the other side of the Pacha you can take a picture at a prepared 'Flower Power' photo booth, take the picture yourself.Upon entry we were welcomed by hostesses working at numerous stalls set up at the front of the venue, providing everything you may need to get you in the Hippie mood: flowers, accessories, hair wigs and even hippy

make up and beauty services.

But what really makes the Flower Power party stand out from all the other parties on the island are the number of amazing, music-themed performances by professional actors and dancers dressed as the

original artists whose music was played at the time.On stage was a huge drum kit decorated with flowers. There is also a VIP room where Mick Jagger and Kate Moss,among others,have already been spotted.

The club is located directly opposite the modern club Ushuaïa is particularly known for the fact that the biggest and most famous DJs in the world give their show here. Names such as Martix Garrix, David Guetta, Dimitri Vegas & Like Mike and The Chainsmokers are no strangers to the club.

This way you have the unique opportunity to enjoy the greatest names in the sun in the afternoon and you can dance to the most delicious beats in the evening when the sun sets. All this along the hotel swimming pool with dancers in the background. The club is open longer during the opening and closing parties.

Ticket prices for the parties range from € 40 to about € 80, depending on the party. We recommend that you pre-order the tickets through the official website or through the promotional teams that you can often find on the popular beaches or in the city. Also keep in mind the high drink prices.

Ushuaïa Beach Hotel is located in Playa d'en Bossa directly on the beach opposite Club Hï. The center of Ibiza Town is approximately 300 m away. Thus, the club is easy to reach on foot from the city or from the beach. You can park in the parking lot near the hotel or along the surrounding streets.

The club is divided into two parts, the Theater part and the Club. Both parts allow you to enjoy a different setting and great parties every evening. Ushuaïa Entertainment certainly did not fail to modernize the club. The club has one of the most modern sound systems, beautiful light shows, three halls and two terraces and these have been given a spectacular appearance.

Also when it comes to big names, the modern club is not inferior to the other clubs. For example, in 2017 the club contracted DJs such as Armin van Buuren, Martix Garrix, Eric Prydz and Black Coffee and these big names will also be on the program for the coming seasons.

The club ticket prices are around € 40 to € 50. If you are on time, you can often take advantage of special early bird promotions and sometimes you can buy your tickets online for € 20. We recommend that you purchase the tickets through the club's official website or through special promotion teams often found around town and on popular beaches. This often saves a lot of money with the tickets at the door on the evening itself.

DC10 Ibiza

Near the airport of Ibiza you will find the club DC10. This club has been an underground club for years and even today the club does little to advertise. The audience that comes here is familiar with the club and only comes for one thing: the music.

DC10 is already etched firmly into the history books of dance music culture, the small farmhouse at the end of the airport runway in Ibiza has become one of the best known clubbing destinations on the planet, principally due to the hedonistic and no holds barred afterhour sessions of Monday daytime party Circo Loco.The beginnings of Circo Loco at DC10 back in Ibiza 1999 could hardly be more humble.

At a virtually unknown location, the iconic Monday morning session started a clubbing revolution that make an enduring impact on the shape of modern club culture. Since then, the ubiquitous Crazy Clown face has travelled around the world as a beacon of the party ethos of Circo Loco, becoming a symbol for the underground spirit of dance music culture and the most copied clubbing imagery ever. Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery.

No glitter & glamor

The club is not known for the popular international DJs or extreme parties with beautiful light shows. The club has to rely on the regular audience what the club knows how to find. And they know that all too well, because the room is often well filled during the well-known parties that the club organizes. Here you will not find exaggerated decoration and glitter & glamor. DC10 is all about the music. The club has developed from the underground scene and the club still maintains this well. Different styles the club is known for are techno house and technotrance.

The club doesn't have an official website where you can get tickets. We therefore recommend that you follow the links to the ticket website via the club's Facebook page. In addition, it is also possible to pay at the door. The entrance fees for the parties are around € 50. Drinking in the club is generally slightly cheaper than the average prices in the clubs in Ibiza. Expect to pay around € 5 for a beer and around € 15 for a mixed drink.

You will find DC10 near the airport of Ibiza near Las Salinas . From Ibiza town is about a 5 minute drive to the club. If you come from San Antonio, it will take you about 20 minutes. Due to its location at the airport, the club has ample parking space.There are also regular buses from Ibiza Town to the airport and DC-10. In addition, all taxi drivers on the island also know where to find the club. From Ibiza town or Playa D'en Bossa you pay about € 10 for a taxi. A taxi from San Antonio will cost you around € 30.

The club has been called Amnesia since the 1970s.Today the club has grown into one of the most popular nightclubs in Ibiza. Musically it is arguably one of the most influential clubs on the island. They are also responsible for the British Acid House eruption and thus caused a musical revolution worldwide!

Amnesia Ibiza is perhaps one of the most iconic clubs and a household name on the island of Ibiza. The club organizes the most diverse parties and gives you the real Ibiza club experience.There are also many Dutch DJs, which makes the club very popular among the Dutch.

The club has an impressive sound system which gives the music an extra dimension.You can not only hear it, but also feel it!

The nightclub has been a household name in Ibiza since the 70s and consists of two large halls where different parties are often given. The top floor of the club is for VIP guests. From there you have a beautiful view of all the partygoers in the room below. If you want to book a VIP table, be on time because they are very popular and there are not too many.

Because it is often very busy, Amnesia Ibiza gives you a real club feeling. Going wild to the beats and throwing their hands in the air with so many partygoers at the same time give you that unique experience. Some evenings the club is filled with a few thousand partygoers. Partly because of this, the club is really a household name in Ibiza.

It is best to buy tickets for the parties through the club's official website or through promotional teams, which are mainly found on the popular beaches and in the city. You pay a lot less online or through these teams than at the door. The ticket prices differ per party, but on average you spend about € 35 to € 50 per ticket. In addition, the opening and closing parties are generally slightly more expensive, but the club is open a bit longer. A beer in the club costs € 10 and for a mixed drink you quickly pay around € 20.

Amnesia Ibiza is centrally located in Ibiza near San Rafael. From Ibiza town it is only a fifteen minute drive to the club. You can park in the club's own car park. All taxi drivers on the island also know where to find the club. A taxi to / from Ibiza town will cost you about € 10. From San Antonio you will spend about € 15 for a taxi. In addition, there are also regular special disco buses that go past the clubs and of course also stop at the Amnesia.

Swag Ibiza

Swag Ibiza opened in 2014, taking control of the nightclub attached to the Hotel Garbi Ibiza that previously bore the name Moma. The goal of Swag? Giving urban music a voice in Ibiza, at a time when the rhythms and beats of hip hop and R&B are finally beginning to have a strong presence across the island. Swag is the place to visit if you are looking for something different. It is urban music in all its forms, be it rap, trap or reggaeton - it is the place for those who want to come to Ibiza and dance with a different rhythmic base.

The disco with a capacity of 1000 people is next to the beach, in the very heart of Playa d'en Bossa. Famous for: being Ibiza's premier hip-hop site.Popular festivals: Soul 2 Soul.It boasts two different VIP areas, so you can upgrade if you want an opportunity to get the winner in you at once; expensive champagne and Gray Goose brand vodka ready to be consumed.

As mentioned, Es Paradis is especially popular for its foam and water parties. Fiesta del Agua is held at the club every Saturday evening. During this party, the fountains in the club start spewing thousands of liters of water, turning the club into one big water festival. Hundreds of wet partygoers dressed in swimwear then go loose here to the most delicious beats of various international DJs.

You can find Es Paradis in San Antonio. The club is easily accessible on foot from the city. If you come by car from Ibiza Town it is about 20 minutes drive. You can park in the streets around the club or in the large parking lot behind the San Antonio boulevard. Every taxi driver on the island knows where to find the club and you pay about € 20 for a taxi to / from Ibiza town.

The prices of the tickets are around € 25 to € 40, depending on the event. We recommend that you buy the tickets through the official website or through the promotion teams that can be found in the cities or on the popular beaches. These tickets are often cheaper than when you buy tickets at the door. A beer costs € 7 and a mixed drink is available from € 10.

The inside of Tantra is quite large for a bar, with plenty of seating to chill on and plenty of floor space to dance on. The front terrace seating area faces on to the main road through Playa d'en Bossa, with new LED screens for decoration and loads of chairs and tables to enjoy your drinks at while either listening to the music from the live DJs or watching sport on the big screen TVs and projectors

While there is also a wooden decking area to the side of the venue for more space, this is rarely used, however it always makes an appearance during the bar's now infamous closing parties, where huge names like Joseph Capriati and Pan-Pot have played.

Tantra plays host to a variety of official pre-parties throughout each season, with many of the major clubs being a short walk from the venue itself. You can expect to see some of the biggest DJs and some of the dance music's future stars playing early in the night.

This busy terrace at number 5, Calle Alfonso XII at foot of the old walls, opens only during the summer season. All kinds of colourful characters frequent this place and even the staff usually wait on you in drag or fancy dress. It holds various parties and tends to be one of the headquarters of Ibiza Gay Pride. A perfect place to see or be seen.

If the visitor is open and tolerant, bar Monalisa guarantees that the visitor will make new friends every evening. What happens in Ibiza stays in Ibiza. During the summer nights, bar Monalisa invites visitors to participate in this adventure in a non-binding manner.

This dance, the so-called "passacalle", is not really a dance, but rather an advertising dance to attract visitors to the most famous parties such as La Troya, Matinee and flower power. Monalisa's cocktails are made from fresh fruit and the best ingredients in the country! Bar Monalisa has even more surprising programs, where the visitor can turn to the bar staff for exact information and possibilities.

Get mad with these hunks! How can you take your eyes away from these Mad Boys showing off what they’ve got?Started their amazing story in the year 2008, Mad Bar has brought superb service to their customers that keep them coming back.

Diversified music is played as well as quality cocktails and beers are served all night long. They always have exciting performances you will never forget. They also work with these best parties: La Troya, Matinee, Cafe Ole, Just Scandal, The Face of Ibiza and many more.

The clientele is usually a mix of gay, straight and swinger, most of whom tend to congregate on the terrace, soaking up the street vibe. It’s a relaxed but fun-filled spot that attracts plenty of fabulous outfits as much as flashing of flesh.

A very friendly team behind the bar support the hunky waiter staff who serve the tables.Known for its fantastic cocktails and the amazing atmosphere.Sunrise is also one of the most “Instagram friendliest” places in Ibiza and you are going to want to take a few pictures. Great DJ, cute just and welcoming vibes.

Its owners Johannes and Ana have been in charge of the business since 2007, which began as a small terrace with 5 tables to become the great space that it is today, the largest terrace on Calle de la Virgen, a comfortable and colorful space where you can start the night tasting one of their famous top quality cocktails.

And watching the parades and characters that give color to the port pass, you will feel at home and Ana goes out of her way to make sure her clients find a place on one of the many guest lists she manages.
